SEARCH
Package com.RPG.Core

Class Item

java.lang.Object
com.RPG.Core.Item
Direct Known Subclasses:
Backpack, Weapon
public abstract class Item extends Object
abstract class representing all items
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ben Demets
Invariants:
every item must have a Valid holder 
isValidHolder()
each different type of item must have a unique ID 
!(item1.getItemType() == item2.getItemType())
Value cannot exceed maxValue 
isValidValue()

      @Raw public boolean isValidWeight(double weight)
      checks if the weight of an Item is a valid one

      Returns:

      result == weight >= 0

    • isValidHolder

      public boolean isValidHolder(Entity Holder)
      checks if the holder of an item is a valid one
      Parameters:
      Holder - the holder that needs to be checked
      Returns:
      true if holder is valid, false otherwise 
      !Holder.isTerminated()

    • isValidValue

      @Raw public boolean isValidValue(int value)
      checks if the value of an item is valid
      Parameters:
      value - the value that needs to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the value is valid, false otherwise 
      result == value >= 0 && value <= this.MaxValue

    • isTerminated

    • isValidItem

      @Raw public boolean isValidItem()
      checks if the Item is valid
      Returns:
      true if Item is not terminated and has a valid Holder, false otherwise 
      if(!isTerminated && isValidHolder)
then result == true

    • terminate

      public void terminate()
      terminates an Item and its relations with other classes
      Effects:
      makes sure both the bidirectional relation with Entity and Backpack is removed properly 
      if backpack != null
then backpack.unpackItem(this)
Holder != null
this.getHolder().unequip(this.getHolder().getAnchorPointWithItem(this), this )
      if this item has content remove everything out of its content 
      if this.getAmountOfItems() > 0
  for index < this.getAmountOfItems(); index++
      this.getBackpack().unpackItem(this.getItemAt(index))
